snippet: The companies are planning to charge as little as $5 a month for new streaming music services, half the cost of the current pricing model.
abstract: Amazon and Pandora Media are both planning to introduce updated versions of their streaming services, with fees as low as $5 a month; lower prices are likely to put pressure on other on-demand streaming services, which currently charge standard rate of $10 a month or nothing at all.

headline.main: Amazon and Pandora to Gauge Musicâ€™s Value in the Internet Age
headline.print_headline: Revamped Streaming Services Plan to Gauge the Value of Music in the Internet Age

snippet: While analysts anticipate a rise in the national median income, new European laws will allow publishers to collect fees from large technology companies.

headline.main: Census Bureau to Report Income Data as Tech Rules Take Effect in Europe
headline.print_headline: Europe Shifts Tech Laws as U.S. Preps Salary Data

snippet: Apple Corps Ltd, the music company founded by members of The Beatles, was accused in a lawsuit on Monday of infringing copyrights of a company claiming to own a master recording of the group's famous 1965 concert in New York's Shea Stadium.

headline.main: Apple Corps Is Sued Over Beatles' 1965 Shea Stadium Film Rights
headline.print_headline: Apple Corps Is Sued Over Beatles' 1965 Shea Stadium Film Rights

snippet: Amazon.com Inc and Pandora Media Inc are planning to launch new versions of their streaming music services in coming weeks, the New York Times reported on Sunday, citing several anonymous people with knowledge of the matter.

headline.main: Amazon and Pandora Set to Launch New Music Streaming Services: NY Times
headline.print_headline: Amazon and Pandora Set to Launch New Music Streaming Services: NY Times

snippet: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd and LG Electronics were accused of agreeing not to poach each other's U.S. employees, according to a U.S. civil lawsuit filed last week, in what has become a familiar allegation in Silicon Valley.

headline.main: Samsung, LG Sued Over U.S. Employee Recruiting Policies
headline.print_headline: Samsung, LG Sued Over U.S. Employee Recruiting Policies

snippet: HSBC's retail banking and wealth management head John Flint expects banks to partner more with financial technology (fintech) companies in the coming years to help meet changing demands from customers.

headline.main: HSBC Retail Head Sees More Bank Partnerships With Financial Tech Firms
headline.print_headline: HSBC Retail Head Sees More Bank Partnerships With Financial Tech Firms

snippet: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd's shares fell to their lowest level in nearly two months on Monday after the tech giant told customers to switch off and return their new Galaxy Note 7 smartphones due to fire-prone batteries.

headline.main: Samsung Electronics Shares Slide as Note 7 Recall Takes Toll
headline.print_headline: Samsung Electronics Shares Slide as Note 7 Recall Takes Toll

snippet: U.S. stocks racked up their strongest gain in two months on Monday after Federal Reserve Board Governor Lael Brainard stuck to her dovish stance on interest rates and urged caution about removing monetary stimulus too quickly.

headline.main: S&P 500 Racks Up Sharpest Rise Since July
headline.print_headline: S&P 500 Racks Up Sharpest Rise Since July

snippet: The Samsung Group's de facto leader and heir apparent is poised to join the board of crown jewel Samsung Electronics Co Ltd, a step towards formalising his role as head of the conglomerate as it reels from a massive smartphone recall.

headline.main: Samsung Scion to Take Board Role at Flagship Amid Note 7 Shock
headline.print_headline: Samsung Scion to Take Board Role at Flagship Amid Note 7 Shock

snippet: The Samsung Group's de facto leader and heir apparent is poised to join the board of crown jewel Samsung Electronics Co Ltd, a step towards formalizing his role as head of the conglomerate as it reels from a massive smartphone recall.

headline.main: Samsung Scion to Take Board Role at Flagship Amid Note 7 Shock
headline.print_headline: Samsung Scion to Take Board Role at Flagship Amid Note 7 Shock
